Functions
```{r}
pow_two <- function(x, print_info = TRUE){
  y <- x^2
  if(print_info){
    print(paste(x, "to the power two equals ", y))
  }
  return (y)
}

result <- pow_two(3)
result <- pow_two(4, FALSE)
result
```

other type of parameters
```{r}
linkedin <- c(16,9,13,5,2,17,14)

interpret <- function(num_views){
  if(num_views>15){
    print("youÂ´re popular")
    return(num_views)
  }
  else{
    print("Try to be more visible!")
    return(0)
  }
}

interpret(linkedin[1])

interpret_all <- function(views, return_sum=TRUE){
  count <- 0
  for (v in views){
    count<- count + interpret(v)
  }
  if(return_sum){
    return(count)
  }else{
    return(NULL)
  }
    
}
interpret_all(linkedin)
```

apply with R

```{r}

temp <- list(c(3,7,9,6,1), c(6,9,12,13,5), c(4,8,3,-1,-3), c(1,4,7,2,-2), c(5,7,9,4,2), c(-3,5,8,9,4), c(3,6,9,4,1))

lapply(temp, min)

for(t in temp){
  print(min(t))
}

select <- function(x){
  print(paste("this collection contains total = ", sum(x)))
}

list<- lapply(temp, select)
list
```
lapply and anonymous functions
```{r}

(function(x){3*x})(9)

pioneers <- c("GAUSS:1777", "BAYES:1702", "PASCAL:1623", "PEARSON:1857")
split <- strsplit(pioneers,split = ":")

split

split_low <- lapply(split,tolower)

names <- lapply(split_low,function(x){x[1]})
names

years <- lapply(split_low,function(x){x[2]})
years
```
use lapply with additional arguments

```{r}

select_el <- function(x, index){
  x[index]
}

names <- lapply(split_low, select_el,1)  
names

years <- lapply(split_low, select_el,2)
years
```
